questions.question_text: During stage 2, an early review of the photo design ideas from the Marketing department has highlighted the need for engineering machinery to be operating in the background during the photo sessions. This requires a change to the baselined Product Description for the photos. What action should the Project Manager take?

discussion.content:
A

This is because any change to the baselined product description is a potential issue that could impact the project’s objectives. It needs to be formally logged, assessed and approved before implementation. The Issue Register is the correct place to log this as it is a central repository for recording and managing issues. The Project Board can then make an informed decision based on the impact of the change.

choices.D: Include this requirement on the next Checkpoint Report to the photographer.
choices.A: Log the change in the Issue Register as a request for change.
choices.C: Revised the Product Description for the photos and issue it to the Engineering Manager to ensure that the machinery will be operating during the photo sessions.
choices.B: Raise an Exception Report to the Project Board.

discussion.content:
The Project Manager should take the following action:

C. Check the target sign-off date for the list of customers.

This is because the list of customers, although quality reviewed, has not been baselined due to incomplete information from the Marketing department. The Project Manager needs to check when this product is expected to be completed (the target sign-off date). If there is a delay, it may impact the project schedule and appropriate action will need to be taken. The other options (A, B, D) might not be the most appropriate initial actions in this situation. They could be considered as subsequent steps depending on the outcome of checking the target sign-off date.

questions.question_text: As the project approaches the end of stage 2, the Project Manager has requested a Product Status Account to ensure that all products are at their expected point of development. Although the list of customers has been quality reviewed, it has not been baselined because the Marketing department have not provided all of the prospective customers' details. What initial action should the Project Manager take?

choices.C: Check the target sign-off date for the list of customers.
choices.B: Raise an Exception Report to the Project Board to highlight the issue.
choices.D: Update the product status to baselined and obtain a commitment from the Marketing department to finish this work within the next few days.
choices.A: Delay producing the End Stage Report until the list of customers has been baselined.

choices.C: Record the observation in an Exception Report to the Project Board.
choices.D: Make an entry in the Lessons Log for future consideration by corporate management.
choices.B: Make a note of the observation in the Daily Log to be transferred to a Benefits Review Plan at the end of the project.
choices.A: Produce a project mandate, outlining the potential savings to be achieved by the introduction of a corporate standard.

discussion.content: The Project Manager should make an entry in the Lessons Log for future consideration by corporate management. This is because the Lessons Log is used to record any knowledge, understanding, or insight gained that would be useful on future projects. In this case, the observation about potential savings from a corporate standard for postage is a valuable insight that could benefit future projects. So, the correct answer is D

questions.question_text:
Whilst identifying the mailing costs for the calendars the Project Manager was surprised to find the costs could vary considerably depending on the size of the package and the delivery service used. For the purpose of this project, the Project Manager has selected an appropriate service but feels that a corporate standard for postage would have reduced the time and effort invested. It could reduce the company's overheads by up to ֲ£20k per year. How should the Project
Manager record this observation within the project?

choices.C: Make an entry in the Risk Register so the Project Manager can decide on appropriate action.
choices.B: Add the product to the next Stage Plan in order to allocate additional resources and complete the work.
choices.D: Raise an issue to inform the Project Manager.
choices.A: Report the forecast delay in the next Checkpoint Report to the Executive.

discussion.content: Raise an issue to inform the Project Manager.
